subject: Re: Servlet Testing - junit or httpunit
msgSnippet: Thanks Toyin The confusion arises as to when to use httpunit or cactus. Also the starting point for Servlet testing isn t very clear compared to writing test
messageBody:
Thanks Toyin

The confusion arises as to when to use httpunit or cactus.

Also the starting point for Servlet testing isn't very clear compared
to writing test cases for a generic Java class using JUnit.

Anand

--- In junit@y..., "Johannes O. Akinlaja" <joa@n...> wrote:
> Cactus or JUnitEE might be the tools you are looking for. HttpUnit
is for
> black box testing only. The normal way to use it is with JUnit. You
should
> find links on the junit web pages.
> Toyin
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: <anand_73@y...>
> To: <junit@y...>
> Sent: Wednesday, August 08, 2001 7:53 AM
> Subject: [junit] Servlet Testing - junit or httpunit
>
>
> > Hi all
> >
> > I have started using junit and the documentation is pretty good to
> > start writing testcases for generic java classes.
> >
> > Now to write testcases for Servlets,do I jump to httpunitest or
stay
> > with junit ?
> >
> > Kindly throw some light in this regard
> > Anand
> >
> >
> >
